``` This snippet uses the `WP_Query` class to query WordPress for posts, using the `post_type` and `posts_per_page` arguments. It then uses a while loop to iterate through the query results, using the `have_posts` and `the_post` functions provided by WordPress. Within the loop, it uses various WordPress template tags such as `the_permalink`, `the_post_thumbnail_url`, `the_category`, `the_excerpt`, and `the_author` to output the post data. It uses a `has_post_thumbnail()` function to check if the post has a featured image and if yes then it displays the featured image. The snippet also uses `wp_reset_postdata()` function to reset global $post variable after the loop ends, this is important if you are using multiple queries on a single page. You can modify this as per your requirement, it is just an example, you can add class to each element and can style it with css as per your design.
